result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:03 PM Defendant Jarmarra MD Wagner in court in custody from Dunn County jail.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Jarmarra MD Wagner.  Attorney Andrew John Maki in court for State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 

Atty Satorius - client will waive preliminary hearing. 
Court - provides prelim waiver colloquy. Court finds free voluntary and understanding of waiver of Defendant's rights to a preliminary examination. Binds DE over for trial.
Atty Satorius - asks for ARGN to be heard.
State - provides Information at this time.

ARGN -
Atty Satorius - rcvd Information. Waive reading. Enter NG Plea. Asks for bond to be heard at this time. Asks for GPS monitor for client and reduction in cash bond. DE can stay with family in WI if GPS monitor is granted.
State - not opposed to bond reduction. Signature bond okay. No contacts to continue accept as authorized by DHS. 
Atty Satorius - agrees with those conditions.

Court - orders bond be modified from $1,000 cash bond to $50.00. Must not leave the State of WI without prior approval of the Court. GPS granted if available and must be worn at all times. Submit to drug testing at discression by department in CHIPS cases. Previous no contact conditions remain.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
